thread.title: 10 Unique Camping Adventures for Your Next...
thread.title_full: 10 Unique Camping Adventures for Your Next...

title: 10 Unique Camping Adventures for Your Next...

locations.name: fort clinch state park  scenic amelia island

text:
Pat Canova/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images Updated January 22, 2016 . 
I enjoy camping because it is relaxing, taking me away from the phone and my everyday existence into a quiet world surrounded by nature. Camping gives me a chance to unwind, catch up on reading and just enjoy some peace and quiet. However, I know there are those of you who would be bored by too much solitude. And, many actually prefer to be entertained, at least some of the time. I'm happy to say that there are Florida campgrounds that can offer the best of both worlds. These really unique campgrounds cater to campers who enjoy specific activities and even enjoy being entertained, but you can still find a quiet place to unwind when needed. 
Farmer's Opry 
Waking up to the sound of a rooster is just the beginning of a unique "country" camping experience in Florida's Panhandle. Camp any weekend and you can also enjoy a country home-cooked dinner and two-hour show at the Farmer's Opry House every Friday and Saturday night. Live entertainment is provided by the Sawmill Band. Special nights that include world-famous country music legends are also a treat. 
Farmer's Opry, 8897 Byrom Campbell Rd, Pace (located north of Pensacola). Camping is $23.00* per night or $20.50* for three or more nights. Call 850-994-6000 for camping reservations. Dinner is served at 4:30 p.m. on Friday and Saturday. Show starts at 7:00 p.m. Dinner tickets including show are $21.95* for adults, $10.95* for children ages 6-12 and children under age 5, $3.50*. Tickets for only the show are also available. 
Florida Caverns State Park 
Open yourself up to a "hole" new experience as you join one of the most fascinating tours within the Florida's state park system, at the only state park to offer cave tours to the public. Hiking and equestrian trails, biking, boating and fishing are also popular pasttimes. 
Florida Caverns State Park , 3345 Caverns Road, Marianna. Camping is $20.00* per night. Phone 850-482-9598 for information. Online reservations at ReserveAmerica.com . 
Fort Clinch State Park 
Scenic Amelia Island is the location of this state park, and the campground is just over the dunes from the Atlantic Ocean. On the first weekend of each month enjoy the soldier reenactments at Fort Clinch . Also, the park is just a short distance from tourist-friendly, historic Downtown Fernandina Beach , where shopping, restaurants, boat tours , carriage rides and ghost tours are just some of the interesting adventures to be enjoyed. 
Fort Clinch State Park , 2601 Atlantic Avenue, Fernandina Beach. Phone 904-277-7274 for information. Reserve campsites online at ReserveAmerica.com . 
Fort Wilderness Resort & Campground 
Are you looking for a camping experience with "character?" Camp with all the modern amenities, but enjoy camping as only Disney can do it â€” dinner shows, character sing-a-longs, movies under the stars, hayrides, carriage rides, horseback riding, fireworks and a lighted boat parade are just some of the fun activities available.
